body_html:
I went to the root directory where I downloaded the tensorflow code:
(bazel is already installed)

c:\Development\Projects\tensorflow

There, I typed "configure" and specified all configuration parameters. For example, where my CUDA and CUDNN directories are etc.

Finally I typed this command:

bazel build --config opt tensorflow/java:tensorflow tensorflow/java:libtensorflow_jni

Btw, this is what Google advises in this link: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/java/README.md

body:
I went to the root directory where I downloaded the tensorflow code:
(bazel is already installed)

c:\Development\Projects\tensorflow

There, I typed "configure" and specified all configuration parameters. For example, where my CUDA and CUDNN directories are etc.

Finally I typed this command:

bazel build --config opt tensorflow/java:tensorflow tensorflow/java:libtensorflow_jni

Btw, this is what Google advises in this link: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/java/README.md
